ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Computational resources, data handling and storage, choosing interesting research topic, networking and communicating, roads to interdisciplinary research, etc. are some of the many highlights one could gain from the discussions involved in this course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course, as an inherent part of how it is framed, required involvement of different faculty members to be a part of it at times, and contribute as guest lecturers on variety of topics that they individually have some expertise on. A few faculty members did, but many didn't. This idea that professional seminars could be a wonderful gateway to exposing students to individual expertise of different faculty members, providing the students the multi-dimensional exposure on how to be a successful scientist, was perhaps the greatest strength of this semester's professional seminar. The fact that many members of the faculty didn't get involved in that fantastic endeavor was perhaps its biggest weakness.

This course was composed entirely of incoherent ramblings from the professor. The students gained nothing from this course, it only served to take away time from research, classes, and teaching duties. Most students just did this other work during the class time. The course could be improved by eliminating it. It's representative of this aging department's outdated practices. There desperately needs to be improvements, because it can't go on like this.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes ...!!! This was rather ill-attended, I too partly take the blame as I wasn't there in all the sessions. But if more and more people attend, interact, and contribute, the better it will be for successfully meeting the whole point of this course.
I would not recommend this course to another student. In its current form, with this professor, it is a complete waste of time.
